skillTree.localised_description: Not a single Executioner have been granted one of these gifts of Khaine previously, Crone Hellebron has made an exception with Tullaris however, a fitting reward for his military contributions.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).
When this unit gets hurt it may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

skillTree.localised_description: There is great pleasure to be derived from the humiliation and suffering of others; this one has felt and revelled in it.
The strength of this warrior's attack never wavers for an instance, such is the opprobrium felt for their hated High Elf cousins.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves

skillTree.localised_description: The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every ritual execution that Tullaris performs serves as a glorious offering to Khaine, driving the other Executioners he leads to match his skill and devotion with further slaughter.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

skillTree.localised_description: "We dominate the seas of the world because they are ours to do with as we will. Our weak willed cousins once held all the oceans in their grasp, but allowed them to slip away as they declined into decadence. Not so, our forces. We strike where and when we will, leaving no doubt who are the true masters of the seas. We make slaves of the lesser races because they are fit for nothing else. It is only just that they should strive for their betters."

The merest rumour that Tullaris and his Executioners are part of an invading Dark Elf army can cause floods of refugees to flee before the Druchii forces and in battle, enemies rout rather than face Tullaris and his deadly warriors.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Under his command, the Executioners have partaken in such cold-blooded destruction that they have gained a fearful reputation across the world. Beneath their banner they march at the head of the army, eagerly seeking battle.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for Har Ganeth Executioners units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Har Ganeth Executioners units
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Deathblow" for Har Ganeth Executioners
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Witch Elves will often follow the Dreadbringer, for death and favour of Khaine usually follows wherever Tullaris goes.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for embedded Death Hags and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for embedded Death Hags and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -30% for embedded Death Hags, Har Ganeth Executioners and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: His life has been punctuated by a bloody behaviour ever since he first heard the calling of Khaine.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Murderous Supremacy"
	(replaces: "Murderous Prowess and Murderous Mastery")
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -30% for embedded Death Hags, Har Ganeth Executioners and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Magic is a most useful tool on the field of battle, but generally secondary in the face of good, old-fashioned brute force.

skillTree.localised_description: The murderous, unforgiving rage of Khaine can be transferred from a Lord to his legions.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"Let your name be on the lips of every man and woman; your great deeds go before you!"
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Lord Khaine. I send you this meagre offering, the first of many, on your night, Death Night. Let this be a sign of the compact between us, and lend your strength to me. Let the murders I commit this night be in your name and for your glory."
